channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Flammable and explosive gas dumped outside 104 Choumert, 19th June
item.description:
Flammable and explosive gas dumped on street. Can you please consider putting CCTV here. It's a common occurrence for flytippers. Been here for days already.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 132, Choumert Road, London

item.title: Strong sewage smell, 19th June
item.description:
There is a strong sewage smell permeating from the Thames Water vent outside Smalley Close. It has been reported as a public health hazard for over 2 years now and is worse when the weather is hot. As far as I am aware, no action has been taken
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Northwold Road, Hackney, London

item.title: The Council’s mowing team are doing a great job at Hoblingwell. The current operator is leaving attractive paths through the grass which is being left longer. This makes it a lovely walk surrounded by a mass of butterflies, bees and insects. The longer grass and railings had refuced fly tipping as woodlands no longer easily accessible with wheelbarrow. Talking to other walkers they have commented on reduction of litter and that new mowing policy gives them paths that lead into the well maintained woodland paths although there are one if two additional tracks they would like across the meadows. As a litter picker and poo collector - I have seen an overall reduction so I think the current policy of mowing is creating the right environment for everybody including wildlife. It is the best I have seen in the last 6 years since I started visiting thus open space. Well done., 19th June
item.description:
There has been a long debate about the maintenance of the grassland meadows around Hoblingwell. I think the mowing team that went in yesterday have done a great job, it looks attractive to the eye, has sufficient mowed paths and spaces for recreation and supports our local wildlife- most people are enjoying the return of wildflowers, bees, grasshoppers and many more. We need to continue to explain to people who think there is a maintenance problem that there are huge benefits. Thank you mowers!
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Leesons Way, St Paul's Cray, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: There is a considerable overhang of trees not only blocking light, but interferring with the overhead broadband and telephone cables, 19th June
item.description:
This report's photos just show one tree but there is at least another that overhangs my property considerably, are extrenely close to my garage and garden wall both now shoing signs of cracking- I shall make an insurance claim for those. But not only do the overhanging branches perpetually drop a large amount of leaves in my property but also interfere with my broadband and telephone overhead cables, as well as blocking light. The large tree shown in the photo and marked on the map is extrenely close to my garage and its roots are also raising up the public footpath

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Tannsfeld Road, Perry Vale, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Deceased fox in the road., 19th June
item.description:
A fox appears to have died overnight and is lying in the middle of the road. Cars are struggling to pass it, but are trying to remain respectful and not touch it, either by driving up onto the path, or turning around. If it can be cleared ASAP that would be great, as a lot of young children walk down the road en-route to school and it could be distressing for them to see.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Ascot Road, Poverest, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Stinks - sewage, 19th June
item.description:

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Sanford Walk, Hackney, London
